App Intro: SDK for building and testing A2V agents.
App Detail: A2V SDK Kit is a complete developer toolkit for building, simulating, and deploying A2V-compatible agents. It includes schema templates, API simulators, and CLI utilities for manifest validation. Developers can connect their local sandbox to A2V's global SSE registry, track execution logs, and monitor cost-per-action through x402 billing emulation. It's the foundation layer for every developer entering the A2V ecosystem.

App Intro: Visual prompt-flow and testing environment for A2V.
App Detail: PromptFlow enables dev teams to design prompt-chains, manage evaluation metrics, and benchmark model responses across multiple agents. It includes built-in A/B testing and integrates with MCP connectors for automated deployments. Using x402 metering, PromptFlow tracks every API call's value consumption and learning outcome. It's ideal for fine-tuning multi-agent communication patterns.

App Intro: Command-line interface for managing A2V agents.
App Detail: AgentCLI brings DevOps-style control to agent orchestration. Developers can spawn, terminate, or inspect A2V agent processes directly from the terminal. It provides log streaming, manifest debugging, and quick schema deployment via SSH or MCP channels. Designed for reliability testing and production-grade maintenance of distributed agent fleets.

App Intro: Schema builder and manifest validation IDE.
App Detail: SchemaLab provides a low-code interface to design and validate A2V manifests. It auto-generates JSON schema, Drizzle ORM mappings, and REST hooks, letting developers publish modules instantly to A2V registries. With built-in version control and x402-linked dependency tracking, SchemaLab ensures schema integrity throughout complex updates.

App Intro: Real-time observability and telemetry dashboard for agents.
App Detail: DevPulse visualizes metrics such as API latency, manifest sync errors, and x402 transaction costs. It aggregates telemetry data across multiple A2V projects and turns them into actionable insights. Teams use it to detect performance regressions, monitor token flow, and optimize memory usage across active agents.

ManiFestor automatically compiles A2V YAML/JSON manifests into deployable service blueprints. It cross-checks schema dependencies and attaches x402 billing logic directly in build-time. Developers can version control manifests as part of Git CI/CD pipelines.

App Intro: Visual development extension for V0 and Cursor.
App Detail: A2V Studio adds schema autocompletion, manifest preview, and agent debugging directly into modern AI IDEs. It syncs developer sessions with live A2V instances, allowing seamless local-to-cloud deployment. The plugin also supports one-click publishing to the A2V marketplace.

App Intro: Automated QA testing for multi-agent networks.
App Detail: TestForge simulates thousands of agent-to-agent transactions to identify deadlocks, concurrency conflicts, or pricing anomalies before deployment. It integrates MCP and x402 transaction logging for full economic simulation. Dev teams use TestForge to certify protocols and prevent logic breaks in production networks.

App Intro: Pipeline management for continuous agent integration.
App Detail: FlowTrack integrates with GitHub Actions, Supabase, and Cloudflare Workers to manage A2V agent deployment lifecycles. It monitors manifest integrity, API regression, and schema drift during upgrades. Each CI pipeline emits an x402 proof record for transparent version accounting.

App Intro: Local sandbox for agent behavior testing.
App Detail: AgentSim allows developers to test new agent logic in a deterministic environment. It replays stored A2V event streams, records agent dialogue trees, and measures performance across iterations. This helps builders validate prompt reliability and cost efficiency before going live.
